body:
Thanks for your patch, although I have to say that the usage seems a bit confusing to me, specially with lambdas:

```ruby
assert_difference( { lambda{@object.num} => 0, lambda{@object.num + 1} => 0 } ) do
  @object.decrement
  @object.increment
end
```

Another thing that makes me think twice is the possibility of giving one `message` to any number of difference expectations:

```ruby
assert_difference( { '@object.num' => -1,
                     '@object.num + 1' => -1,
                     :message => "Foo! Expected @object to decrease by one" } ) do
  # ...
end
```

I'm happy with nested `assert_difference` when necessary, even with RSpec where you can do `expect {}.to change`, nesting looks ok. Well, just my 2 cents.

@josevalim @rafaelfranca thoughts?
